2672 

2673 def iter_runs(self, idxs=False, run_sel=None): 

2674 """Generator for iterating through the runs of a file. 

2675 

2676 Parameters 

2677 ---------- 

2678 idxs : bool 

2679 If True yields the run index in addition to the group. 

2680 

2681 run_sel : list of int, optional 

2682 If not None should be a list of the runs you want to iterate over. 

2683 

2684 

2685 Yields 

2686 ------ 

2687 run_idx : int, if idxs is True 

2688 

2689 run_group : h5py.Group 

2690 

2691 """ 

2692 

2693 if run_sel is None: 

2694 run_sel = self.run_idxs 

2695 

2696 for run_idx in self.run_idxs: 

2697 if run_idx in run_sel: 

2698 run = self.run(run_idx) 

2699 if idxs: 

2700 yield run_idx, run 

2701 else: 

2702 yield run 

2703 

2704 def iter_trajs(self, idxs=False, traj_sel=None): 

2705 """Generator for iterating over trajectories in a file. 

2706 

2707 Parameters 

2708 ---------- 

2709 idxs : bool 

2710 If True returns a tuple of the run index and trajectory 

2711 index in addition to the trajectory group. 

2712 traj_sel : list of int, optional 

2713 If not None is a list of tuples of (run_idx, traj_idx) 

2714 selecting which trajectories to iterate over. 

2715 

2716 Yields 

2717 ------ 

2718 traj_id : tuple of int, if idxs is True 

2719 A tuple of (run_idx, traj_idx) for the group 

2720 

2721 trajectory : h5py.Group 

2722 """ 

2723 

2724 

2725 # set the selection of trajectories to iterate over 

2726 if traj_sel is None: 

2727 idx_tups = self.run_traj_idx_tuples() 

2728 else: 

2729 idx_tups = traj_sel 

2730 

2731 # get each traj for each idx_tup and yield them for the generator 

2732 for run_idx, traj_idx in idx_tups: 

2733 traj = self.traj(run_idx, traj_idx) 

2734 if idxs: 

2735 yield (run_idx, traj_idx), traj 

2736 else: 

2737 yield traj 

2738 

2739 def iter_run_trajs(self, run_idx, idxs=False): 

2740 """Iterate over the trajectories of a run. 

2741 

2742 Parameters 

2743 ---------- 

2744 run_idx : int 

2745 idxs : bool 

2746 If True returns a tuple of the run index and trajectory 

2747 index in addition to the trajectory group. 

2748 

2749 

2750 Returns 

2751 ------- 

2752 iter_trajs_generator : generator for the iter_trajs method 

2753 

2754 """ 

2755 run_sel = self.run_traj_idx_tuples([run_idx]) 

2756 return self.iter_trajs(idxs=idxs, traj_sel=run_sel)

2759 ### Settings 

2760 

2761 @property 

2762 def defined_traj_field_names(self): 

2763 """A list of the settings defined field names all trajectories have in the file.""" 

2764 

2765 return list(self.field_feature_shapes.keys()) 

2766 

2767 @property 

2768 def observable_field_names(self): 

2769 """Returns a list of the names of the observables that all trajectories have. 

2770 

2771 If this encounters observable fields that don't occur in all 

2772 trajectories (inconsistency) raises an inconsistency error. 

2773 

2774 """ 

2775 

2776 n_trajs = self.num_trajs 

2777 field_names = Counter() 

2778 for traj in self.iter_trajs(): 

2779 for name in list(traj['observables']): 

2780 field_names[name] += 1 

2781 

2782 # if any of the field names has not occured for every 

2783 # trajectory we raise an error 

2784 for field_name, count in field_names: 

2785 if count != n_trajs: 

2786 raise TypeError("observable field names are inconsistent") 

2787 

2788 # otherwise return the field names for the observables 

2789 return list(field_names.keys()) 

2790 

2791 def _check_traj_field_consistency(self, field_names): 

2792 """Checks that every trajectory has the given fields across 

2793 the entire dataset. 

2794 

2795 Parameters 

2796 ---------- 

2797 

2798 field_names : list of str 

2799 The field names to check for. 

2800 

2801 Returns 

2802 ------- 

2803 consistent : bool 

2804 True if all trajs have the fields, False otherwise 

2805 

2806 """ 

2807 

2808 n_trajs = self.num_trajs 

2809 field_names = Counter() 

2810 for traj in self.iter_trajs(): 

2811 for name in field_names: 

2812 if name in traj: 

2813 field_names[name] += 1 

2814 

2815 # if any of the field names has not occured for every 

2816 # trajectory we raise an error 

2817 for field_name, count in field_names: 

2818 if count != n_trajs: 

2819 return False 

2820 

2821 return True

2874 @property 

2875 def field_feature_shapes(self): 

2876 """Mapping of the names of the trajectory fields to their feature 

2877 vector shapes.""" 

2878 

2879 shapes_grp = self.h5['{}/{}'.format(SETTINGS, FIELD_FEATURE_SHAPES_STR)] 

2880 

2881 field_paths = _iter_field_paths(shapes_grp) 

2882 

2883 shapes = {} 

2884 for field_path in field_paths: 

2885 shape = shapes_grp[field_path][()] 

2886 if np.isnan(shape).all(): 

2887 shapes[field_path] = None 

2888 else: 

2889 shapes[field_path] = shape 

2890 

2891 return shapes 

2892 

2893 @property 

2894 def field_feature_dtypes(self): 

2895 """Mapping of the names of the trajectory fields to their feature 

2896 vector numpy dtypes.""" 

2897 

2898 dtypes_grp = self.h5['{}/{}'.format(SETTINGS, FIELD_FEATURE_DTYPES_STR)] 

2899 

2900 field_paths = _iter_field_paths(dtypes_grp) 

2901 

2902 dtypes = {} 

2903 for field_path in field_paths: 

2904 dtype_str = dtypes_grp[field_path][()] 

2905 # if there is 'None' flag for the dtype then return None 

2906 if dtype_str == NONE_STR: 

2907 dtypes[field_path] = None 

2908 else: 

2909 dtype_obj = json.loads(dtype_str) 

2910 dtype_obj = [tuple(d) for d in dtype_obj] 

2911 dtype = np.dtype(dtype_obj) 

2912 dtypes[field_path] = dtype 

2913 

2914 return dtypes

2976 ### Topology 

2977 

2978 def get_topology(self, alt_rep=POSITIONS): 

2979 """Get the JSON topology for a particular represenation of the positions. 

2980 

2981 By default gives the topology for the main 'positions' field 

2982 (when alt_rep 'positions'). To get the full topology the file 

2983 was initialized with set `alt_rep` to `None`. Topologies for 

2984 alternative representations (subfields of 'alt_reps') can be 

2985 obtained by passing in the key for that alt_rep. For example, 

2986 'all_atoms' for the field in alt_reps called 'all_atoms'. 

2987 

2988 Parameters 

2989 ---------- 

2990 alt_rep : str 

2991 The base name of the alternate representation, or 'positions', or None. 

2992 

2993 

2994 Returns 

2995 ------- 

2996 topology : str 

2997 The JSON topology string for the representation. 

2998 

2999 """ 

3000 

3001 top = self.topology 

3002 

3003 # if no alternative representation is given we just return the 

3004 # full topology 

3005 if alt_rep is None: 

3006 pass 

3007 

3008 # otherwise we either give the main representation topology 

3009 # subset 

3010 elif alt_rep == POSITIONS: 

3011 top = json_top_subset(top, self.main_rep_idxs) 

3012 

3013 # or choose one of the alternative representations 

3014 elif alt_rep in self.alt_reps_idxs: 

3015 top = json_top_subset(top, self.alt_reps_idxs[alt_rep]) 

3016 

3017 # and raise an error if the given alternative representation 

3018 # is not given 

3019 else: 

3020 raise ValueError("alt_rep {} not found".format(alt_rep)) 

3021 

3022 return top 

3023 

3024 @property 

3025 def topology(self): 

3026 """The topology for the full simulated system. 

3027 

3028 May not be the main representation in the POSITIONS field; for 

3029 that use the `get_topology` method. 

3030 

3031 Returns 

3032 ------- 

3033 topology : str 

3034 The JSON topology string for the full representation. 

3035 

3036 """ 

3037 return self._h5[TOPOLOGY][()] 

3038 

3039 

3040 def get_mdtraj_topology(self, alt_rep=POSITIONS): 

3041 """Get an mdtraj.Topology object for a system representation. 

3042 

3043 By default gives the topology for the main 'positions' field 

3044 (when alt_rep 'positions'). To get the full topology the file 

3045 was initialized with set `alt_rep` to `None`. Topologies for 

3046 alternative representations (subfields of 'alt_reps') can be 

3047 obtained by passing in the key for that alt_rep. For example, 

3048 'all_atoms' for the field in alt_reps called 'all_atoms'. 

3049 

3050 Parameters 

3051 ---------- 

3052 alt_rep : str 

3053 The base name of the alternate representation, or 'positions', or None. 

3054 

3055 Returns 

3056 ------- 

3057 topology : str 

3058 The JSON topology string for the full representation. 

3059 

3060 """ 

3061 

3062 json_top = self.get_topology(alt_rep=alt_rep) 

3063 return json_to_mdtraj_topology(json_top) 

3064 

3065 ## Initial walkers 

3066 

3067 def initial_walker_fields(self, run_idx, fields, walker_idxs=None): 

3068 """Get fields from the initial walkers of the simulation. 

3069 

3070 Parameters 

3071 ---------- 

3072 run_idx : int 

3073 Run to get initial walkers for. 

3074 

3075 fields : list of str 

3076 Names of the fields you want to retrieve. 

3077 

3078 walker_idxs : None or list of int 

3079 If None returns all of the walkers fields, otherwise a 

3080 list of ints that are a selection from those walkers. 

3081 

3082 Returns 

3083 ------- 

3084 walker_fields : dict of str : array of shape 

3085 Dictionary mapping fields to the values for all 

3086 walkers. Frames will be either in counting order if no 

3087 indices were requested or the order of the walker indices 

3088 as given. 

3089 

3090 """ 

3091 

3092 # set the walker indices if not specified 

3093 if walker_idxs is None: 

3094 walker_idxs = range(self.num_init_walkers(run_idx)) 

3095 

3096 init_walker_fields = {field : [] for field in fields} 

3097 

3098 # for each walker go through and add the selected fields 

3099 for walker_idx in walker_idxs: 

3100 init_walker_grp = self.init_walkers_grp(run_idx)[str(walker_idx)] 

3101 for field in fields: 

3102 # we remove the first dimension because we just want 

3103 # them as a single frame 

3104 init_walker_fields[field].append(init_walker_grp[field][:][0]) 

3105 

3106 # convert the field values to arrays 

3107 init_walker_fields = {field : np.array(val) for field, val in init_walker_fields.items()} 

3108 

3109 return init_walker_fields 

3110 

3111 def initial_walkers_to_mdtraj(self, run_idx, walker_idxs=None, alt_rep=POSITIONS): 

3112 """Generate an mdtraj Trajectory from a trace of frames from the runs. 

3113 

3114 Uses the default fields for positions (unless an alternate 

3115 representation is specified) and box vectors which are assumed 

3116 to be present in the trajectory fields. 

3117 

3118 The time value for the mdtraj trajectory is set to the cycle 

3119 indices for each trace frame. 

3120 

3121 This is useful for converting WepyHDF5 data to common 

3122 molecular dynamics data formats accessible through the mdtraj 

3123 library. 

3124 

3125 Parameters 

3126 ---------- 

3127 run_idx : int 

3128 Run to get initial walkers for. 

3129 

3130 fields : list of str 

3131 Names of the fields you want to retrieve. 

3132 

3133 walker_idxs : None or list of int 

3134 If None returns all of the walkers fields, otherwise a 

3135 list of ints that are a selection from those walkers. 

3136 

3137 alt_rep : None or str 

3138 If None uses default 'positions' representation otherwise 

3139 chooses the representation from the 'alt_reps' compound field. 

3140 

3141 Returns 

3142 ------- 

3143 traj : mdtraj.Trajectory 

3144 

3145 """ 

3146 

3147 rep_path = self._choose_rep_path(alt_rep) 

3148 

3149 init_walker_fields = self.initial_walker_fields(run_idx, [rep_path, BOX_VECTORS], 

3150 walker_idxs=walker_idxs) 

3151 

3152 return self.traj_fields_to_mdtraj(init_walker_fields, alt_rep=alt_rep) 

3153

3274 def run_traj_idx_tuples(self, runs=None): 

3275 """Get identifier tuples (run_idx, traj_idx) for all trajectories in 

3276 all runs. 

3277 

3278 Parameters 

3279 ---------- 

3280 runs : list of int, optional 

3281 If not None, a list of run indices to restrict to. 

3282 

3283 Returns 

3284 ------- 

3285 run_traj_tuples : list of tuple of int 

3286 A listing of all trajectories by their identifying tuple 

3287 of (run_idx, traj_idx). 

3288 

3289 """ 

3290 tups = [] 

3291 if runs is None: 

3292 run_idxs = self.run_idxs 

3293 else: 

3294 run_idxs = runs 

3295 for run_idx in run_idxs: 

3296 for traj_idx in self.run_traj_idxs(run_idx): 

3297 tups.append((run_idx, traj_idx)) 

3298 

3299 return tups

3301 def get_traj_field_cycle_idxs(self, run_idx, traj_idx, field_path): 

3302 """Returns the cycle indices for a sparse trajectory field. 

3303 

3304 Parameters 

3305 ---------- 

3306 run_idx : int 

3307 traj_idx : int 

3308 field_path : str 

3309 Name of the trajectory field 

3310 

3311 Returns 

3312 ------- 

3313 cycle_idxs : arraylike of int 

3314 

3315 """ 

3316 

3317 traj_path = '{}/{}/{}/{}'.format(RUNS, run_idx, TRAJECTORIES, traj_idx) 

3318 

3319 if not field_path in self._h5[traj_path]: 

3320 raise KeyError("key for field {} not found".format(field_path)) 

3321 

3322 # if the field is not sparse just return the cycle indices for 

3323 # that run 

3324 if field_path not in self.sparse_fields: 

3325 cycle_idxs = np.array(range(self.num_run_cycles(run_idx))) 

3326 else: 

3327 cycle_idxs = self._h5[traj_path][field_path][SPARSE_IDXS][:] 

3328 

3329 return cycle_idxs

3359 ### Aggregation 

3360 

3361 def is_run_contig(self, run_idxs): 

3362 """This method checks that if a given list of run indices is a valid 

3363 contig or not. 

3364 

3365 Parameters 

3366 ---------- 

3367 run_idxs : list of int 

3368 The run indices that would make up the contig in order. 

3369 

3370 Returns 

3371 ------- 

3372 is_contig : bool 

3373 

3374 """ 

3375 run_idx_continuations = [np.array([run_idxs[idx+1], run_idxs[idx]]) 

3376 for idx in range(len(run_idxs)-1)] 

3377 #gets the contigs array 

3378 continuations = self.settings_grp[CONTINUATIONS][:] 

3379 

3380 # checks if sub contigs are in contigs list or not. 

3381 for run_continuous in run_idx_continuations: 

3382 contig = False 

3383 for continuous in continuations: 

3384 if np.array_equal(run_continuous, continuous): 

3385 contig = True 

3386 if not contig: 

3387 return False 

3388 

3389 return True 

3390 

3391 def clone(self, path, mode='x'): 

3392 """Clone the header information of this file into another file. 

3393 

3394 Clones this WepyHDF5 file without any of the actual runs and run 

3395 data. This includes the topology, units, sparse_fields, 

3396 feature shapes and dtypes, alt_reps, and main representation 

3397 information. 

3398 

3399 This method will flush the buffers for this file. 

3400 

3401 Does not preserve metadata pertaining to inter-run 

3402 relationships like continuations. 

3403 

3404 Parameters 

3405 ---------- 

3406 path : str 

3407 File path to save the new file. 

3408 mode : str 

3409 The mode to open the new file with. 

3410 

3411 Returns 

3412 ------- 

3413 new_file : h5py.File 

3414 The handle to the new file. It will be closed. 

3415 

3416 """ 

3417 

3418 assert mode in ['w', 'w-', 'x'], "must be opened in a file creation mode" 

3419 

3420 # we manually construct an HDF5 and copy the groups over 

3421 new_h5 = h5py.File(path, mode=mode, libver=H5PY_LIBVER) 

3422 

3423 new_h5.require_group(RUNS) 

3424 

3425 # flush the datasets buffers 

3426 self.h5.flush() 

3427 new_h5.flush() 

3428 

3429 # copy the existing datasets to the new one 

3430 h5py.h5o.copy(self._h5.id, TOPOLOGY.encode(), new_h5.id, TOPOLOGY.encode()) 

3431 h5py.h5o.copy(self._h5.id, UNITS.encode(), new_h5.id, UNITS.encode()) 

3432 h5py.h5o.copy(self._h5.id, SETTINGS.encode(), new_h5.id, SETTINGS.encode()) 

3433 

3434 # now make a WepyHDF5 object in "expert_mode" which means it 

3435 # is just empy and we construct it manually, "surgically" as I 

3436 # like to call it 

3437 new_wepy_h5 = WepyHDF5(path, expert_mode=True) 

3438 

3439 # perform the surgery: 

3440 

3441 # attach the h5py.File 

3442 new_wepy_h5._h5 = new_h5 

3443 # set the wepy mode to read-write since the creation flags 

3444 # were already used in construction of the h5py.File object 

3445 new_wepy_h5._wepy_mode = 'r+' 

3446 new_wepy_h5._h5py_mode = 'r+' 

3447 

3448 # for the settings we need to get rid of the data for interun 

3449 # relationships like the continuations, so we reinitialize the 

3450 # continuations for the new file 

3451 new_wepy_h5._init_continuations() 

3452 

3453 # close the h5py.File and set the attribute to closed 

3454 new_wepy_h5._h5.close() 

3455 new_wepy_h5.closed = True 

3456 

3457 

3458 # return the runless WepyHDF5 object 

3459 return new_wepy_h5 

3460 

3461 

3462 def link_run(self, filepath, run_idx, continue_run=None, **kwargs): 

3463 """Add a run from another file to this one as an HDF5 external 

3464 link. 

3465 

3466 Parameters 

3467 ---------- 

3468 filepath : str 

3469 File path to the HDF5 file that the run is on. 

3470 run_idx : int 

3471 The run index from the target file you want to link. 

3472 continue_run : int, optional 

3473 The run from the linking WepyHDF5 file you want the target 

3474 linked run to continue. 

3475 

3476 kwargs : dict 

3477 Adds metadata (h5py.attrs) to the linked run. 

3478 

3479 Returns 

3480 ------- 

3481 linked_run_idx : int 

3482 The index of the linked run in the linking file. 

3483 

3484 """ 

3485 

3486 # link to the external run 

3487 ext_run_link = h5py.ExternalLink(filepath, '{}/{}'.format(RUNS, run_idx)) 

3488 

3489 # the run index in this file, as determined by the counter 

3490 here_run_idx = self.next_run_idx() 

3491 

3492 # set the local run as the external link to the other run 

3493 self._h5['{}/{}'.format(RUNS, here_run_idx)] = ext_run_link 

3494 

3495 # run the initialization routines for adding a run 

3496 self._add_run_init(here_run_idx, continue_run=continue_run) 

3497 

3498 run_grp = self._h5['{}/{}'.format(RUNS, here_run_idx)] 

3499 

3500 # add metadata if given 

3501 for key, val in kwargs.items(): 

3502 if key != RUN_IDX: 

3503 run_grp.attrs[key] = val 

3504 else: 

3505 warn('run_idx metadata is set by wepy and cannot be used', RuntimeWarning) 

3506 

3507 return here_run_idx 

3508 

3509 def link_file_runs(self, wepy_h5_path): 

3510 """Link all runs from another WepyHDF5 file. 

3511 

3512 This preserves continuations within that file. This will open 

3513 the file if not already opened. 

3514 

3515 Parameters 

3516 ---------- 

3517 wepy_h5_path : str 

3518 Filepath to the file you want to link runs from. 

3519 

3520 Returns 

3521 ------- 

3522 new_run_idxs : list of int 

3523 The new run idxs from the linking file. 

3524 """ 

3525 

3526 wepy_h5 = WepyHDF5(wepy_h5_path, mode='r') 

3527 with wepy_h5: 

3528 ext_run_idxs = wepy_h5.run_idxs 

3529 continuations = wepy_h5.continuations 

3530 

3531 # add the runs 

3532 new_run_idxs = [] 

3533 for ext_run_idx in ext_run_idxs: 

3534 

3535 # link the next run, and get its new run index 

3536 new_run_idx = self.link_run(wepy_h5_path, ext_run_idx) 

3537 

3538 # save that run idx 

3539 new_run_idxs.append(new_run_idx) 

3540 

3541 # copy the continuations over translating the run idxs, 

3542 # for each continuation in the other files continuations 

3543 for continuation in continuations: 

3544 

3545 # translate each run index from the external file 

3546 # continuations to the run idxs they were just assigned in 

3547 # this file 

3548 self.add_continuation(new_run_idxs[continuation[0]], 

3549 new_run_idxs[continuation[1]]) 

3550 

3551 return new_run_idxs 

3552 

3553 def extract_run(self, filepath, run_idx, 

3554 continue_run=None, 

3555 run_slice=None, 

3556 **kwargs): 

3557 """Add a run from another file to this one by copying it and 

3558 truncating it if necessary. 

3559 

3560 Parameters 

3561 ---------- 

3562 filepath : str 

3563 File path to the HDF5 file that the run is on. 

3564 run_idx : int 

3565 The run index from the target file you want to link. 

3566 continue_run : int, optional 

3567 The run from the linking WepyHDF5 file you want the target 

3568 linked run to continue. 

3569 run_slice :  

3570 

3571 kwargs : dict 

3572 Adds metadata (h5py.attrs) to the linked run. 

3573 

3574 Returns 

3575 ------- 

3576 linked_run_idx : int 

3577 The index of the linked run in the linking file. 

3578 

3579 """ 

3580 

3581 # close ourselves if not already done, so we can write using 

3582 # the lower level API 

3583 was_open = False 

3584 if not self.closed: 

3585 self.close() 

3586 was_open = True 

3587 

3588 # do the copying 

3589 

3590 # open the other file and get the runs in it and the 

3591 # continuations it has 

3592 wepy_h5 = WepyHDF5(filepath, mode='r') 

3593 

3594 

3595 

3596 with self: 

3597 # normalize our HDF5s path 

3598 self_path = osp.realpath(self.filename) 

3599 # the run index in this file, as determined by the counter 

3600 here_run_idx = self.next_run_idx() 

3601 

3602 # get the group name for the new run in this HDF5 

3603 target_grp_path = "/runs/{}".format(here_run_idx) 

3604 

3605 with wepy_h5: 

3606 # link the next run, and get its new run index 

3607 new_h5 = wepy_h5.copy_run_slice(run_idx, self_path, 

3608 target_grp_path, 

3609 run_slice=run_slice, 

3610 mode='r+') 

3611 

3612 # close it since we are done 

3613 new_h5.close() 

3614 

3615 

3616 with self: 

3617 

3618 # run the initialization routines for adding a run, just 

3619 # sets some metadata 

3620 self._add_run_init(here_run_idx, continue_run=continue_run) 

3621 

3622 run_grp = self._h5['{}/{}'.format(RUNS, here_run_idx)] 

3623 

3624 # add metadata if given 

3625 for key, val in kwargs.items(): 

3626 if key != RUN_IDX: 

3627 run_grp.attrs[key] = val 

3628 else: 

3629 warn('run_idx metadata is set by wepy and cannot be used', RuntimeWarning) 

3630 

3631 if was_open: 

3632 self.open() 

3633 

3634 return here_run_idx 

3635 

3636 

3637 def extract_file_runs(self, wepy_h5_path, 

3638 run_slices=None): 

3639 """Extract (copying and truncating appropriately) all runs from 

3640 another WepyHDF5 file. 

3641 

3642 This preserves continuations within that file. This will open 

3643 the file if not already opened. 

3644 

3645 Parameters 

3646 ---------- 

3647 wepy_h5_path : str 

3648 Filepath to the file you want to link runs from. 

3649 

3650 Returns 

3651 ------- 

3652 new_run_idxs : list of int 

3653 The new run idxs from the linking file. 

3654 

3655 """ 

3656 

3657 if run_slices is None: 

3658 run_slices = {} 

3659 

3660 

3661 # open the other file and get the runs in it and the 

3662 # continuations it has 

3663 wepy_h5 = WepyHDF5(wepy_h5_path, mode='r') 

3664 with wepy_h5: 

3665 # the run idx in the external file 

3666 ext_run_idxs = wepy_h5.run_idxs 

3667 continuations = wepy_h5.continuations 

3668 

3669 # then for each run in it copy them to this file 

3670 new_run_idxs = [] 

3671 for ext_run_idx in ext_run_idxs: 

3672 

3673 # get the run_slice spec for the run in the other file 

3674 run_slice = run_slices[ext_run_idx] 

3675 

3676 # get the index this run should be when it is added 

3677 new_run_idx = self.extract_run(wepy_h5_path, ext_run_idx, 

3678 run_slice=run_slice) 

3679 

3680 # save that run idx 

3681 new_run_idxs.append(new_run_idx) 

3682 

3683 was_closed = False 

3684 if self.closed: 

3685 self.open() 

3686 was_closed = True 

3687 

3688 # copy the continuations over translating the run idxs, 

3689 # for each continuation in the other files continuations 

3690 for continuation in continuations: 

3691 

3692 # translate each run index from the external file 

3693 # continuations to the run idxs they were just assigned in 

3694 # this file 

3695 self.add_continuation(new_run_idxs[continuation[0]], 

3696 new_run_idxs[continuation[1]]) 

3697 

3698 if was_closed: 

3699 self.close() 

3700 

3701 return new_run_idxs 

3702 

3703 

3704 def join(self, other_h5): 

3705 """Given another WepyHDF5 file object does a left join on this 

3706 file, renumbering the runs starting from this file. 

3707 

3708 This function uses the H5O function for copying. Data will be 

3709 copied not linked. 

3710 

3711 Parameters 

3712 ---------- 

3713 other_h5 : h5py.File 

3714 File handle to the file you want to join to this one. 

3715 

3716 """ 

3717 

3718 with other_h5 as h5: 

3719 for run_idx in h5.run_idxs: 

3720 # the other run group handle 

3721 other_run = h5.run(run_idx) 

3722 # copy this run to this file in the next run_idx group 

3723 self.h5.copy(other_run, '{}/{}'.format(RUNS, self.next_run_idx())) 

3724 

3725 

3726 ### initialization and data generation 

3727 

3728 def add_metadata(self, key, value): 

3729 """Add metadata for the whole file. 

3730 

3731 Parameters 

3732 ---------- 

3733 key : str 

3734 value : h5py value 

3735 h5py valid metadata value. 

3736 

3737 """ 

3738 self._h5.attrs[key] = value

3740 

3741 def init_record_fields(self, run_record_key, record_fields): 

3742 """Initialize the settings record fields for a record group in the 

3743 settings group. 

3744 

3745 Save which records are to be considered from a run record group's 

3746 datasets to be in the table like representation. This exists 

3747 to allow there to large and small datasets for records to be 

3748 stored together but allow for a more compact single table like 

3749 representation to be produced for serialization. 

3750 

3751 Parameters 

3752 ---------- 

3753 run_record_key : str 

3754 Name of the record group you want to set this for. 

3755 record_fields : list of str 

3756 Names of the fields you want to set as record fields. 

3757 

3758 """ 

3759 

3760 record_fields_grp = self.settings_grp[RECORD_FIELDS] 

3761 

3762 # make a dataset for the sparse fields allowed. this requires 

3763 # a 'special' datatype for variable length strings. This is 

3764 # supported by HDF5 but not numpy. 

3765 vlen_str_dt = h5py.special_dtype(vlen=str) 

3766 

3767 # create the dataset with the strings of the fields which are records 

3768 record_group_fields_ds = record_fields_grp.create_dataset(run_record_key, 

3769 (len(record_fields),), 

3770 dtype=vlen_str_dt, 

3771 maxshape=(None,)) 

3772 

3773 # set the flags 

3774 for i, record_field in enumerate(record_fields): 

3775 record_group_fields_ds[i] = record_field 

3776

3783 The resampler which contains the data for which record fields to set. 

3784 

3785 """ 

3786 self.init_record_fields(RESAMPLING, resampler.resampling_record_field_names())

3832 def add_continuation(self, continuation_run, base_run): 

3833 """Add a continuation between runs. 

3834 

3835 Parameters 

3836 ---------- 

3837 continuation_run : int 

3838 The run index of the run that will be continuing another 

3839 base_run : int 

3840 The run that is being continued. 

3841 

3842 """ 

3843 

3844 continuations_dset = self.settings_grp[CONTINUATIONS] 

3845 continuations_dset.resize((continuations_dset.shape[0] + 1, continuations_dset.shape[1],)) 

3846 continuations_dset[continuations_dset.shape[0] - 1] = np.array([continuation_run, base_run]) 

3847 

3848 def new_run(self, init_walkers, continue_run=None, **kwargs): 

3849 """Initialize a new run. 

3850 

3851 Parameters 

3852 ---------- 

3853 init_walkers : list of objects implementing the Walker interface 

3854 The walkers that will be the start of this run. 

3855 continue_run : int, optional 

3856 If this run is a continuation of another set which one it is continuing. 

3857 

3858 kwargs : dict 

3859 Metadata to set for the run. 

3860 

3861 Returns 

3862 ------- 

3863 run_grp : h5py.Group 

3864 The group of the newly created run. 

3865 

3866 """ 

3867 

3868 # check to see if the continue_run is actually in this file 

3869 if continue_run is not None: 

3870 if continue_run not in self.run_idxs: 

3871 raise ValueError("The continue_run idx given, {}, is not present in this file".format( 

3872 continue_run)) 

3873 

3874 # get the index for this run 

3875 new_run_idx = self.next_run_idx() 

3876 

3877 # create a new group named the next integer in the counter 

3878 run_grp = self._h5.create_group('{}/{}'.format(RUNS, new_run_idx)) 

3879 

3880 

3881 # set the initial walkers group 

3882 init_walkers_grp = run_grp.create_group(INIT_WALKERS) 

3883 

3884 self._add_init_walkers(init_walkers_grp, init_walkers) 

3885 

3886 # initialize the walkers group 

3887 traj_grp = run_grp.create_group(TRAJECTORIES) 

3888 

3889 

3890 # run the initialization routines for adding a run 

3891 self._add_run_init(new_run_idx, continue_run=continue_run) 

3892 

3893 

3894 # add metadata if given 

3895 for key, val in kwargs.items(): 

3896 if key != RUN_IDX: 

3897 run_grp.attrs[key] = val 

3898 else: 

3899 warn('run_idx metadata is set by wepy and cannot be used', RuntimeWarning) 

3900 

3901 return run_grp

3905 def init_run_resampling(self, run_idx, resampler): 

3906 """Initialize data for resampling records. 

3907 

3908 Initialized the run record group as well as settings for the 

3909 fields. 

3910 

3911 This method also creates the decision group for the run. 

3912

3917 The resampler which contains the data for which record fields to set. 

3918 

3919 Returns 

3920 ------- 

3921 record_grp : h5py.Group 

3922 

3923 """ 

3924 

3925 # set the enumeration of the decisions 

3926 self.init_run_resampling_decision(0, resampler) 

3927

3929 resampler.resampler_record_field_names() 

3930 resampler.resampling_record_field_names() 

3931 

3932 # then make the records group 

3933 fields = resampler.resampling_fields()

3935

4050 # application level methods for initializing the run records 

4051 # groups with just the fields and without the objects 

4052 def init_run_fields_resampling(self, run_idx, fields): 

4053 """Initialize this record group fields datasets. 

4054

4064

4068

4164 def init_run_record_grp(self, run_idx, run_record_key, fields): 

4165 """Initialize a record group for a run. 

4166 

4167 Parameters 

4168 ---------- 

4169 run_idx : int 

4170 run_record_key : str 

4171 The name of the record group. 

4172 fields : list of str 

4173 The names of the fields to set for the record group. 

4174 """ 

4175 

4176 # initialize the record group based on whether it is sporadic 

4177 # or continual 

4178 if self._is_sporadic_records(run_record_key): 

4179 grp = self._init_run_sporadic_record_grp(run_idx, run_record_key, 

4180 fields) 

4181 else: 

4182 grp = self._init_run_continual_record_grp(run_idx, run_record_key, 

4183 fields) 

4184 

4185 

4186 # TODO: should've been removed already just double checking things are good without it 

4187 # def traj_n_frames(self, run_idx, traj_idx): 

4188 # """ 

4189 

4190 # Parameters 

4191 # ---------- 

4192 # run_idx : 

4193 

4194 # traj_idx : 

4195 

4196 

4197 # Returns 

4198 # ------- 

4199 

4200 # """ 

4201 # return self.traj(run_idx, traj_idx)[POSITIONS].shape[0] 

4202 

4203 def add_traj(self, run_idx, data, weights=None, sparse_idxs=None, metadata=None): 

4204 """Add a full trajectory to a run. 

4205 

4206 Parameters 

4207 ---------- 

4208 run_idx : int 

4209 data : dict of str : arraylike 

4210 Mapping of trajectory fields to the data for them to add. 

4211 weights : 1-D arraylike of float 

4212 The weights of each frame. If None defaults all frames to 1.0. 

4213 

4214 sparse_idxs : list of int 

4215 Cycle indices the data corresponds to. 

4216 

4217 metadata : dict of str : value 

4218 Metadata for the trajectory. 

4219 

4220 

4221 Returns 

4222 ------- 

4223 traj_grp : h5py.Group 

4224 

4225 """ 

4226 

4227 # convenient alias 

4228 traj_data = data 

4229 

4230 # initialize None kwargs 

4231 if sparse_idxs is None: 

4232 sparse_idxs = {} 

4233 if metadata is None: 

4234 metadata = {} 

4235 

4236 # positions are mandatory 

4237 assert POSITIONS in traj_data, "positions must be given to create a trajectory" 

4238 assert isinstance(traj_data[POSITIONS], np.ndarray) 

4239 

4240 n_frames = traj_data[POSITIONS].shape[0] 

4241 

4242 # if weights are None then we assume they are 1.0 

4243 if weights is None: 

4244 weights = np.ones((n_frames, 1), dtype=float) 

4245 else: 

4246 assert isinstance(weights, np.ndarray), "weights must be a numpy.ndarray" 

4247 assert weights.shape[0] == n_frames,\ 

4248 "weights and the number of frames must be the same length" 

4249 

4250 # current traj_idx 

4251 traj_idx = self.next_run_traj_idx(run_idx) 

4252 # make a group for this trajectory, with the current traj_idx 

4253 # for this run 

4254 traj_grp = self._h5.create_group( 

4255 '{}/{}/{}/{}'.format(RUNS, run_idx, TRAJECTORIES, traj_idx)) 

4256 

4257 # add the run_idx as metadata 

4258 traj_grp.attrs[RUN_IDX] = run_idx 

4259 # add the traj_idx as metadata 

4260 traj_grp.attrs[TRAJ_IDX] = traj_idx 

4261 

4262 

4263 # add the rest of the metadata if given 

4264 for key, val in metadata.items(): 

4265 if not key in [RUN_IDX, TRAJ_IDX]: 

4266 traj_grp.attrs[key] = val 

4267 else: 

4268 warn("run_idx and traj_idx are used by wepy and cannot be set", RuntimeWarning) 

4269 

4270 

4271 # check to make sure the positions are the right shape 

4272 assert traj_data[POSITIONS].shape[1] == self.num_atoms, \ 

4273 "positions given have different number of atoms: {}, should be {}".format( 

4274 traj_data[POSITIONS].shape[1], self.num_atoms) 

4275 assert traj_data[POSITIONS].shape[2] == self.num_dims, \ 

4276 "positions given have different number of dims: {}, should be {}".format( 

4277 traj_data[POSITIONS].shape[2], self.num_dims) 

4278 

4279 # add datasets to the traj group 

4280 

4281 # weights 

4282 traj_grp.create_dataset(WEIGHTS, data=weights, dtype=WEIGHT_DTYPE, 

4283 maxshape=(None, *WEIGHT_SHAPE)) 

4284 # positions 

4285 

4286 positions_shape = traj_data[POSITIONS].shape 

4287 

4288 # add the rest of the traj_data 

4289 for field_path, field_data in traj_data.items(): 

4290 

4291 # if there were sparse idxs for this field pass them in 

4292 if field_path in sparse_idxs: 

4293 field_sparse_idxs = sparse_idxs[field_path] 

4294 # if this is a sparse field and no sparse_idxs were given 

4295 # we still need to initialize it as a sparse field so it 

4296 # can be extended properly so we make sparse_idxs to match 

4297 # the full length of this initial trajectory data 

4298 elif field_path in self.sparse_fields: 

4299 field_sparse_idxs = np.arange(positions_shape[0]) 

4300 # otherwise it is not a sparse field so we just pass in None 

4301 else: 

4302 field_sparse_idxs = None 

4303 

4304 self._add_traj_field_data(run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, field_data, 

4305 sparse_idxs=field_sparse_idxs) 

4306 

4307 ## initialize empty sparse fields 

4308 # get the sparse field datasets that haven't been initialized 

4309 traj_init_fields = list(sparse_idxs.keys()) + list(traj_data.keys()) 

4310 uninit_sparse_fields = set(self.sparse_fields).difference(traj_init_fields) 

4311 # the shapes 

4312 uninit_sparse_shapes = [self.field_feature_shapes[field] for field in uninit_sparse_fields] 

4313 # the dtypes 

4314 uninit_sparse_dtypes = [self.field_feature_dtypes[field] for field in uninit_sparse_fields] 

4315 # initialize the sparse fields in the hdf5 

4316 self._init_traj_fields(run_idx, traj_idx, 

4317 uninit_sparse_fields, uninit_sparse_shapes, uninit_sparse_dtypes) 

4318 

4319 return traj_grp 

4320 

4321 def extend_traj(self, run_idx, traj_idx, data, weights=None): 

4322 """Extend a trajectory with data for all fields. 

4323 

4324 Parameters 

4325 ---------- 

4326 run_idx : int 

4327 traj_idx : int 

4328 data : dict of str : arraylike 

4329 The data to add for each field of the trajectory. Must all 

4330 have the same first dimension. 

4331 weights : arraylike 

4332 Weights for the frames of the trajectory. If None defaults all frames to 1.0. 

4333 

4334 """ 

4335 

4336 if self._wepy_mode == 'c-': 

4337 assert self._append_flags[dataset_key], "dataset is not available for appending to" 

4338 

4339 # convenient alias 

4340 traj_data = data 

4341 

4342 # number of frames to add 

4343 n_new_frames = traj_data[POSITIONS].shape[0] 

4344 

4345 n_frames = self.num_traj_frames(run_idx, traj_idx) 

4346 

4347 # calculate the new sparse idxs for sparse fields that may be 

4348 # being added 

4349 sparse_idxs = np.array(range(n_frames, n_frames + n_new_frames)) 

4350 

4351 # get the trajectory group 

4352 traj_grp = self._h5['{}/{}/{}/{}'.format(RUNS, run_idx, TRAJECTORIES, traj_idx)] 

4353 

4354 ## weights 

4355 

4356 # if weights are None then we assume they are 1.0 

4357 if weights is None: 

4358 weights = np.ones((n_new_frames, 1), dtype=float) 

4359 else: 

4360 assert isinstance(weights, np.ndarray), "weights must be a numpy.ndarray" 

4361 assert weights.shape[0] == n_new_frames,\ 

4362 "weights and the number of frames must be the same length" 

4363 

4364 # add the weights 

4365 weights_ds = traj_grp[WEIGHTS] 

4366 

4367 # append to the dataset on the first dimension, keeping the 

4368 # others the same, if they exist 

4369 if len(weights_ds.shape) > 1: 

4370 weights_ds.resize( (weights_ds.shape[0] + n_new_frames, *weights_ds.shape[1:]) ) 

4371 else: 

4372 weights_ds.resize( (weights_ds.shape[0] + n_new_frames, ) ) 

4373 

4374 # add the new data 

4375 weights_ds[-n_new_frames:, ...] = weights 

4376 

4377 

4378 # add the other fields 

4379 for field_path, field_data in traj_data.items(): 

4380 

4381 # if the field hasn't been initialized yet initialize it, 

4382 # unless we are in SWMR mode 

4383 if not field_path in traj_grp: 

4384 

4385 # if in SWMR mode you cannot create groups so if we 

4386 # are in SWMR mode raise a warning that the data won't 

4387 # be recorded 

4388 if self.swmr_mode: 

4389 warn("New datasets cannot be created while in SWMR mode. The field {} will" 

4390 "not be saved. If you want to save this it must be" 

4391 "previously created".format(field_path)) 

4392 else: 

4393 

4394 feature_shape = field_data.shape[1:] 

4395 feature_dtype = field_data.dtype 

4396 

4397 # not specified as sparse_field, no settings 

4398 if (not field_path in self.field_feature_shapes) and \ 

4399 (not field_path in self.field_feature_dtypes) and \ 

4400 not field_path in self.sparse_fields: 

4401 # only save if it is an observable 

4402 is_observable = False 

4403 if '/' in field_path: 

4404 group_name = field_path.split('/')[0] 

4405 if group_name == OBSERVABLES: 

4406 is_observable = True 

4407 if is_observable: 

4408 warn("the field '{}' was received but not previously specified" 

4409 " but is being added because it is in observables.".format(field_path)) 

4410 # save sparse_field flag, shape, and dtype 

4411 self._add_sparse_field_flag(field_path) 

4412 self._set_field_feature_shape(field_path, feature_shape) 

4413 self._set_field_feature_dtype(field_path, feature_dtype) 

4414 else: 

4415 raise ValueError("the field '{}' was received but not previously specified" 

4416 "it is being ignored because it is not an observable.".format(field_path)) 

4417 

4418 # specified as sparse_field but no settings given 

4419 elif (self.field_feature_shapes[field_path] is None and 

4420 self.field_feature_dtypes[field_path] is None) and \ 

4421 field_path in self.sparse_fields: 

4422 # set the feature shape and dtype since these 

4423 # should be 0 in the settings 

4424 self._set_field_feature_shape(field_path, feature_shape) 

4425 

4426 self._set_field_feature_dtype(field_path, feature_dtype) 

4427 

4428 # initialize 

4429 self._init_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, feature_shape, feature_dtype) 

4430 

4431 # extend it either as a sparse field or a contiguous field 

4432 if field_path in self.sparse_fields: 

4433 self._extend_sparse_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, field_data, sparse_idxs) 

4434 else: 

4435 self._extend_contiguous_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, field_data) 

4436

4516 def extend_cycle_run_group_records(self, run_idx, run_record_key, cycle_idx, fields_data): 

4517 """Extend data for a whole records group. 

4518 

4519 This must have the cycle index for the data it is appending as 

4520 this is done for sporadic and continual datasets. 

4521 

4522 Parameters 

4523 ---------- 

4524 run_idx : int 

4525 run_record_key : str 

4526 Name of the record group. 

4527 cycle_idx : int 

4528 The cycle index these records correspond to. 

4529 fields_data : dict of str : arraylike 

4530 Mapping of the field name to the values for the records being added. 

4531 

4532 """ 

4533 

4534 record_grp = self.records_grp(run_idx, run_record_key) 

4535 

4536 # if it is sporadic add the cycle idx 

4537 if self._is_sporadic_records(run_record_key): 

4538 

4539 # get the cycle idxs dataset 

4540 record_cycle_idxs_ds = record_grp[CYCLE_IDXS] 

4541 

4542 # number of old and new records 

4543 n_new_records = len(fields_data) 

4544 n_existing_records = record_cycle_idxs_ds.shape[0] 

4545 

4546 # make a new chunk for the new records 

4547 record_cycle_idxs_ds.resize( (n_existing_records + n_new_records,) ) 

4548 

4549 # add an array of the cycle idx for each record 

4550 record_cycle_idxs_ds[n_existing_records:] = np.full((n_new_records,), cycle_idx) 

4551 

4552 # then add all the data for the field 

4553 for record_dict in fields_data: 

4554 for field_name, field_data in record_dict.items(): 

4555 self._extend_run_record_data_field(run_idx, run_record_key, 

4556 field_name, np.array([field_data])) 

4557

4560 ## Record Getters 

4561 

4562 def run_records(self, run_idx, run_record_key): 

4563 """Get the records for a record group for a single run. 

4564 

4565 Parameters 

4566 ---------- 

4567 run_idx : int 

4568 run_record_key : str 

4569 The name of the record group. 

4570 

4571 Returns 

4572 ------- 

4573 records : list of namedtuple objects 

4574 The list of records for the run's record group. 

4575 

4576 """ 

4577 

4578 # wrap this in a list since the underlying functions accept a 

4579 # list of records 

4580 run_idxs = [run_idx] 

4581 

4582 return self.run_contig_records(run_idxs, run_record_key) 

4583 

4584 def run_contig_records(self, run_idxs, run_record_key): 

4585 """Get the records for a record group for the contig that is formed by 

4586 the run indices. 

4587 

4588 This alters the cycle indices for the records so that they 

4589 appear to have come from a single run. That is they are the 

4590 cycle indices of the contig. 

4591 

4592 Parameters 

4593 ---------- 

4594 run_idxs : list of int 

4595 The run indices that form a contig. (i.e. element 1 

4596 continues element 0) 

4597 

4598 run_record_key : str 

4599 Name of the record group. 

4600 

4601 Returns 

4602 ------- 

4603 records : list of namedtuple objects 

4604 The list of records for the contig's record group. 

4605 

4606 """ 

4607 

4608 # if there are no fields return an empty list 

4609 record_fields = self.record_fields[run_record_key] 

4610 if len(record_fields) == 0: 

4611 return [] 

4612 

4613 # get the iterator for the record idxs, if the group is 

4614 # sporadic then we just use the cycle idxs 

4615 if self._is_sporadic_records(run_record_key): 

4616 records = self._run_records_sporadic(run_idxs, run_record_key) 

4617 else: 

4618 records = self._run_records_continual(run_idxs, run_record_key) 

4619 

4620 return records 

4621

4624 a pandas DataFrame.

4627 ---------- 

4628 run_idx : int 

4629 run_record_key : str 

4630 Name of record group. 

4631 

4632 Returns 

4633 ------- 

4634 record_df : pandas.DataFrame 

4635 """ 

4636 records = self.run_records(run_idx, run_record_key) 

4637 return pd.DataFrame(records)

4707 

4708 This alters the cycle indices for the records so that they 

4709 appear to have come from a single run. That is they are the 

4710 cycle indices of the contig. 

4711 

4712 Parameters 

4713 ---------- 

4714 run_idxs : list of int 

4715 The run indices that form a contig. (i.e. element 1 

4716 continues element 0) 

4717 

4718 Returns 

4719 ------- 

4720 records : list of namedtuple objects 

4721 The list of records for the contig's record group. 

4722 

4723 """ 

4724 

4725 return self.run_contig_records(run_idxs, RESAMPLER)

4919 def add_run_observable(self, run_idx, observable_name, data, sparse_idxs=None): 

4920 """Add a trajectory sub-field in the compound field "observables" for 

4921 a single run. 

4922 

4923 Parameters 

4924 ---------- 

4925 run_idx : int 

4926 observable_name : str 

4927 What to name the observable subfield. 

4928 data : arraylike of shape (n_trajs, feature_vector_shape[0], ...) 

4929 The data for all of the trajectories that will be set to 

4930 this observable field. 

4931 sparse_idxs : list of int, optional 

4932 If not None, specifies the cycle indices this data corresponds to. 

4933 

4934 """ 

4935 obs_path = '{}/{}'.format(OBSERVABLES, observable_name) 

4936 

4937 self._add_run_field(run_idx, obs_path, data, sparse_idxs=sparse_idxs) 

4938 

4939 def add_traj_observable(self, observable_name, data, sparse_idxs=None): 

4940 """Add a trajectory sub-field in the compound field "observables" for 

4941 an entire file, on a trajectory basis. 

4942 

4943 Parameters 

4944 ---------- 

4945 observable_name : str 

4946 What to name the observable subfield. 

4947 

4948 data : list of arraylike 

4949 The data for each run are the elements of this 

4950 argument. Each element is an arraylike of shape 

4951 (n_traj_frames, feature_vector_shape[0],...) where the 

4952 n_run_frames is the number of frames in trajectory. 

4953 

4954 sparse_idxs : list of list of int, optional 

4955 If not None, specifies the cycle indices this data 

4956 corresponds to. First by run, then by trajectory. 

4957 

4958 """ 

4959 obs_path = '{}/{}'.format(OBSERVABLES, observable_name) 

4960 

4961 run_results = [] 

4962 

4963 for run_idx in range(self.num_runs): 

4964 

4965 run_num_trajs = self.num_run_trajs(run_idx) 

4966 run_results.append([]) 

4967 

4968 for traj_idx in range(run_num_trajs): 

4969 run_results[run_idx].append(data[(run_idx * run_num_trajs) + traj_idx]) 

4970 

4971 run_sparse_idxs = None 

4972 if sparse_idxs is not None: 

4973 run_sparse_idxs = [] 

4974 

4975 for run_idx in range(self.num_runs): 

4976 

4977 run_num_trajs = self.num_run_trajs(run_idx) 

4978 run_sparse_idxs.append([]) 

4979 

4980 for traj_idx in range(run_num_trajs): 

4981 run_sparse_idxs[run_idx].append(sparse_idxs[(run_idx * run_num_trajs) + traj_idx]) 

4982 

4983 self.add_observable(observable_name, run_results, 

4984 sparse_idxs=run_sparse_idxs) 

4985
