4990 an entire file, on a compound run and trajectory basis. 

4991 

4992 Parameters 

4993 ---------- 

4994 observable_name : str 

4995 What to name the observable subfield. 

4996 

4997 data : list of list of arraylike 

4998 

4999 The data for each run are the elements of this 

5000 argument. Each element is a list of the trajectory 

5001 observable arraylikes of shape (n_traj_frames, 

5002 feature_vector_shape[0],...). 

5003 

5004 sparse_idxs : list of list of int, optional 

5005 If not None, specifies the cycle indices this data 

5006 corresponds to. First by run, then by trajectory. 

5007 

5008 """ 

5009 obs_path = '{}/{}'.format(OBSERVABLES, observable_name) 

5010 

5011 self._add_field(obs_path, data, sparse_idxs=sparse_idxs) 

5012 

5013 def compute_observable(self, func, fields, args, 

5014 map_func=map, 

5015 traj_sel=None, 

5016 save_to_hdf5=None, idxs=False, return_results=True): 

5017 """Compute an observable on the trajectory data according to a 

5018 function. Optionally save that data in the observables data group for 

5019 the trajectory. 

5020 

5021 Parameters 

5022 ---------- 

5023 func : callable 

5024 The function to apply to the trajectory fields (by 

5025 cycle). Must accept a dictionary mapping string trajectory 

5026 field names to a feature vector for that cycle and return 

5027 an arraylike. May accept other positional arguments as well. 

5028 

5029 fields : list of str 

5030 A list of trajectory field names to pass to the mapped function. 

5031 

5032 args : tuple 

5033 A single tuple of arguments which will be expanded and 

5034 passed to the mapped function for every evaluation. 

5035 

5036 map_func : callable 

5037 The mapping function. The implementation of how to map the 

5038 computation function over the data. Default is the python 

5039 builtin `map` function. Can be a parallel implementation 

5040 for example. 

5041 

5042 traj_sel : list of tuple, optional 

5043 If not None, a list of trajectory identifier tuple 

5044 (run_idx, traj_idx) to restrict the computation to. 

5045 

5046 save_to_hdf5 : None or string, optional 

5047 If not None, a string that specifies the name of the 

5048 observables sub-field that the computed values will be saved to. 

5049 

5050 idxs : bool 

5051 If True will return the trajectory identifier tuple 

5052 (run_idx, traj_idx) along with other return values. 

5053 

5054 return_results : bool 

5055 If True will return the results of the mapping. If not 

5056 using the 'save_to_hdf5' option, be sure to use this or 

5057 results will be lost. 

5058 

5059 Returns 

5060 ------- 

5061 

5062 traj_id_tuples : list of tuple of int, if 'idxs' option is True 

5063 A list of the tuple identifiers for each trajectory result. 

5064 

5065 results : list of arraylike, if 'return_results' option is True 

5066 A list of arraylike feature vectors for each trajectory. 

5067 

5068 """ 

5069 

5070 if save_to_hdf5 is not None: 

5071 assert self.mode in ['w', 'w-', 'x', 'r+', 'c', 'c-'],\ 

5072 "File must be in a write mode" 

5073 assert isinstance(save_to_hdf5, str),\ 

5074 "`save_to_hdf5` should be the field name to save the data in the `observables`"\ 

5075 " group in each trajectory" 

5076 

5077 # the field name comes from this kwarg if it satisfies the 

5078 # string condition above 

5079 field_name = save_to_hdf5 

5080 

5081 # calculate the results and accumulate them here 

5082 results = [] 

5083 

5084 # and the indices of the results 

5085 result_idxs = [] 

5086 

5087 

5088 # map over the trajectories and apply the function and save 

5089 # the results 

5090 for result in self.traj_fields_map(func, fields, args, 

5091 map_func=map_func, traj_sel=traj_sel, idxs=True): 

5092 

5093 idx_tup, obs_features = result 

5094 

5095 results.append(obs_features) 

5096 result_idxs.append(idx_tup) 

5097 

5098 # we want to separate writing and computation so we can do it 

5099 # in parallel without having multiple writers. So if we are 

5100 # writing directly to the HDF5 we add the results to it. 

5101 

5102 # if we are saving this to the trajectories observables add it as a dataset 

5103 if save_to_hdf5: 

5104 

5105 for idx_tup, traj_results in zip(result_idxs, results): 

5106 

5107 run_idx, traj_idx = idx_tup 

5108 

5109 logging.info("Saving run {} traj {} observables/{}".format( 

5110 run_idx, traj_idx, field_name)) 

5111 

5112 # try to get the observables group or make it if it doesn't exist 

5113 try: 

5114 obs_grp = self.traj(run_idx, traj_idx)[OBSERVABLES] 

5115 except KeyError: 

5116 

5117 logging.info("Group uninitialized. Initializing.") 

5118 

5119 obs_grp = self.traj(run_idx, traj_idx).create_group(OBSERVABLES) 

5120 

5121 # try to create the dataset 

5122 try: 

5123 obs_grp.create_dataset(field_name, data=obs_features) 

5124 # if it fails we either overwrite or raise an error 

5125 except RuntimeError: 

5126 # if we are in a permissive write mode we delete the 

5127 # old dataset and add the new one, overwriting old data 

5128 if self.mode in ['w', 'w-', 'x', 'r+']: 

5129 

5130 logging.info("Dataset already present. Overwriting.") 

5131 

5132 del obs_grp[field_name] 

5133 obs_grp.create_dataset(field_name, data=obs_features) 

5134 # this will happen in 'c' and 'c-' modes 

5135 else: 

5136 raise RuntimeError( 

5137 "Dataset already exists and file is in concatenate mode ('c' or 'c-')") 

5138 

5139 

5140 if return_results: 

5141 if idxs: 

5142 return result_idxs, results 

5143 else: 

5144 return results 

5145 ## Trajectory Getters 

5146 

5147 def get_traj_field(self, run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, frames=None, masked=True): 

5148 """Returns a numpy array for the given trajectory field. 

5149 

5150 You can control how sparse fields are returned using the 

5151 `masked` option. When True (default) a masked numpy array will 

5152 be returned such that you can get which cycles it is from, 

5153 when False an unmasked array of the data will be returned 

5154 which has no cycle information. 

5155 

5156 Parameters 

5157 ---------- 

5158 run_idx : int 

5159 traj_idx : int 

5160 field_path : str 

5161 Name of the trajectory field to get 

5162 

5163 frames : None or list of int 

5164 If not None, a list of the frame indices of the trajectory 

5165 to return values for. 

5166 

5167 masked : bool 

5168 If true will return sparse field values as masked arrays, 

5169 otherwise just returns the compacted data. 

5170 

5171 Returns 

5172 ------- 

5173 field_data : arraylike 

5174 The data for the trajectory field. 

5175 

5176 """ 

5177 

5178 traj_path = '{}/{}/{}/{}'.format(RUNS, run_idx, TRAJECTORIES, traj_idx) 

5179 

5180 # if the field doesn't exist return None 

5181 if not field_path in self._h5[traj_path]: 

5182 raise KeyError("key for field {} not found".format(field_path)) 

5183 # return None 

5184 

5185 # get the field depending on whether it is sparse or not 

5186 if field_path in self.sparse_fields: 

5187 return self._get_sparse_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, 

5188 frames=frames, masked=masked) 

5189 else: 

5190 return self._get_contiguous_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field_path, 

5191 frames=frames) 

5192 

5193 def get_trace_fields(self, frame_tups, fields, 

5194 same_order=True): 

5195 """Get trajectory field data for the frames specified by the trace. 

5196 

5197 Parameters 

5198 ---------- 

5199 frame_tups : list of tuple of int 

5200 The trace values. Each tuple is of the form 

5201 (run_idx, traj_idx, frame_idx). 

5202 

5203 fields : list of str 

5204 The names of the fields to get for each frame. 

5205 

5206 same_order : bool 

5207 (Default = True) 

5208 If True will ensure that the results will be sorted exactly 

5209 as the order of the frame_tups were. If False will return 

5210 them in an arbitrary implementation determined order that 

5211 should be more efficient. 

5212 

5213 Returns 

5214 ------- 

5215 trace_fields : dict of str : arraylike 

5216 Mapping of the field names to the array of feature vectors 

5217 for the trace. 

5218 

5219 """ 

5220 

5221 # TODO optimize by doing reads in chunks 

5222 opt_flag = True 

5223 

5224 if opt_flag: 

5225 

5226 def argsort(seq): 

5227 return sorted(range(len(seq)), key=seq.__getitem__) 

5228 

5229 def apply_argsorted(shuffled_seq, sorted_idxs): 

5230 return [shuffled_seq[i] for i in sorted_idxs] 

5231 

5232 # first sort the frame_tups so we can chunk them up by 

5233 # (run, traj) to get more efficient reads since these are 

5234 # chunked by these datasets. 

5235 

5236 # we do an argsort here so that we can map fields back to 

5237 # the order they came in (if requested) 

5238 sorted_idxs = argsort(frame_tups) 

5239 

5240 # then sort them as we will iterate through them 

5241 sorted_frame_tups = apply_argsorted(frame_tups, sorted_idxs) 

5242 

5243 # generate the chunks by (run, traj) 

5244 read_chunks = defaultdict(list) 

5245 for run_idx, traj_idx, frame_idx in sorted_frame_tups: 

5246 read_chunks[(run_idx, traj_idx)].append(frame_idx) 

5247 

5248 # go through each chunk and read data for each field 

5249 frame_fields = {} 

5250 for field in fields: 

5251 

5252 # for each field collect the chunks 

5253 field_chunks = [] 

5254 

5255 for chunk_key, frames in read_chunks.items(): 

5256 run_idx, traj_idx = chunk_key 

5257 

5258 frames_field = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field, 

5259 frames=frames) 

5260 

5261 field_chunks.append(frames_field) 

5262 

5263 # then aggregate them 

5264 field_unsorted = np.concatenate(field_chunks) 

5265 del field_chunks; gc.collect() 

5266 

5267 # if we want them sorted sort them back to the 

5268 # original (unsorted) order, otherwise just return 

5269 # them 

5270 if same_order: 

5271 frame_fields[field] = field_unsorted[sorted_idxs] 

5272 else: 

5273 frame_fields[field] = field_unsorted 

5274 

5275 del field_unsorted; gc.collect() 

5276 

5277 

5278 else: 

5279 

5280 frame_fields = {field : [] for field in fields} 

5281 for run_idx, traj_idx, cycle_idx in frame_tups: 

5282 for field in fields: 

5283 frame_field = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field, frames=[cycle_idx]) 

5284 # the first dimension doesn't matter here since we 

5285 # only get one frame at a time. 

5286 frame_fields[field].append(frame_field[0]) 

5287 

5288 # combine all the parts of each field into single arrays 

5289 for field in fields: 

5290 frame_fields[field] = np.array(frame_fields[field]) 

5291 

5292 return frame_fields 

5293 

5294 def get_run_trace_fields(self, run_idx, frame_tups, fields): 

5295 """Get trajectory field data for the frames specified by the trace 

5296 within a single run. 

5297 

5298 Parameters 

5299 ---------- 

5300 run_idx : int 

5301 

5302 frame_tups : list of tuple of int 

5303 The trace values. Each tuple is of the form 

5304 (traj_idx, frame_idx). 

5305 

5306 fields : list of str 

5307 The names of the fields to get for each frame. 

5308 

5309 Returns 

5310 ------- 

5311 trace_fields : dict of str : arraylike 

5312 Mapping of the field names to the array of feature vectors 

5313 for the trace. 

5314 

5315 """ 

5316 frame_fields = {field : [] for field in fields} 

5317 for traj_idx, cycle_idx in frame_tups: 

5318 for field in fields: 

5319 

5320 

5321 

5322 

5323 frame_field = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field, frames=[cycle_idx]) 

5324 # the first dimension doesn't matter here since we 

5325 # only get one frame at a time. 

5326 frame_fields[field].append(frame_field[0]) 

5327 

5328 # combine all the parts of each field into single arrays 

5329 for field in fields: 

5330 frame_fields[field] = np.array(frame_fields[field]) 

5331 

5332 return frame_fields 

5333 

5334 

5335 def get_contig_trace_fields(self, contig_trace, fields): 

5336 """Get field data for all trajectories of a contig for the frames 

5337 specified by the contig trace. 

5338 

5339 Parameters 

5340 ---------- 

5341 contig_trace : list of tuple of int 

5342 The trace values. Each tuple is of the form 

5343 (run_idx, frame_idx). 

5344 

5345 fields : list of str 

5346 The names of the fields to get for each cycle. 

5347 

5348 Returns 

5349 ------- 

5350 contig_fields : dict of str : arraylike 

5351 of shape (n_cycles, n_trajs, field_feature_shape[0],...) 

5352 Mapping of the field names to the array of feature vectors 

5353 for contig trace. 

5354 

5355 """ 

5356 

5357 # to be efficient we want to group our grabbing of fields by run 

5358 

5359 # so we group them by run 

5360 runs_frames = defaultdict(list) 

5361 # and we get the runs in the order to fetch them 

5362 run_idxs = [] 

5363 for run_idx, cycle_idx in contig_trace: 

5364 runs_frames[run_idx].append(cycle_idx) 

5365 

5366 if not run_idx in run_idxs: 

5367 run_idxs.append(run_idx) 

5368 

5369 

5370 # (there must be the same number of trajectories in each run) 

5371 n_trajs_test = self.num_run_trajs(run_idxs[0]) 

5372 assert all([True if n_trajs_test == self.num_run_trajs(run_idx) else False 

5373 for run_idx in run_idxs]) 

5374 

5375 # then using this we go run by run and get all the 

5376 # trajectories 

5377 field_values = {} 

5378 for field in fields: 

5379 

5380 # we gather trajectories in "bundles" (think sticks 

5381 # strapped together) and each bundle represents a run, we 

5382 # will concatenate the ends of the bundles together to get 

5383 # the full array at the end 

5384 bundles = [] 

5385 for run_idx in run_idxs: 

5386 

5387 run_bundle = [] 

5388 for traj_idx in self.run_traj_idxs(run_idx): 

5389 

5390 # get the values for this (field, run, trajectory) 

5391 traj_field_vals = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field, 

5392 frames=runs_frames[run_idx], 

5393 masked=True) 

5394 

5395 run_bundle.append(traj_field_vals) 

5396 

5397 # convert this "bundle" of trajectory values (think 

5398 # sticks side by side) into an array 

5399 run_bundle = np.array(run_bundle) 

5400 bundles.append(run_bundle) 

5401 

5402 # stick the bundles together end to end to make the value 

5403 # for this field , the first dimension currently is the 

5404 # trajectory_index, but we want to make the cycles the 

5405 # first dimension. So we stack them along that axis then 

5406 # transpose the first two axes (not the rest of them which 

5407 # should stay the same). Pardon the log terminology, but I 

5408 # don't know a name for a bunch of bundles taped together. 

5409 field_log = np.hstack(tuple(bundles)) 

5410 field_log = np.swapaxes(field_log, 0, 1) 

5411 

5412 field_values[field] = field_log 

5413 

5414 

5415 return field_values 

5416 

5417 def iter_trajs_fields(self, fields, idxs=False, traj_sel=None): 

5418 """Generator for iterating over fields trajectories in a file. 

5419 

5420 Parameters 

5421 ---------- 

5422 fields : list of str 

5423 Names of the trajectory fields you want to yield. 

5424 

5425 idxs : bool 

5426 If True will also return the tuple identifier of the 

5427 trajectory the field data is from. 

5428 

5429 traj_sel : list of tuple of int 

5430 If not None, a list of trajectory identifiers to restrict 

5431 iteration over. 

5432 

5433 Yields 

5434 ------ 

5435 traj_identifier : tuple of int if 'idxs' option is True 

5436 Tuple identifying the trajectory the data belongs to 

5437 (run_idx, traj_idx). 

5438 

5439 fields_data : dict of str : arraylike 

5440 Mapping of the field name to the array of feature vectors 

5441 of that field for this trajectory. 

5442 

5443 """ 

5444 

5445 for idx_tup, traj in self.iter_trajs(idxs=True, traj_sel=traj_sel): 

5446 run_idx, traj_idx = idx_tup 

5447 

5448 dsets = {} 

5449 

5450 # DEBUG if we ask for debug prints send in the run and 

5451 # traj index so the function can print this out TESTING if 

5452 # this causes no problems (it doesn't seem like it would 

5453 # from the code this will be removed permanently) 

5454 

5455 # dsets['run_idx'] = run_idx 

5456 # dsets[TRAJ_IDX] = traj_idx 

5457 

5458 for field in fields: 

5459 try: 

5460 dset = traj[field][:] 

5461 except KeyError: 

5462 warn("field \"{}\" not found in \"{}\"".format(field, traj.name), RuntimeWarning) 

5463 dset = None 

5464 

5465 dsets[field] = dset 

5466 

5467 if idxs: 

5468 yield (run_idx, traj_idx), dsets 

5469 else: 

5470 yield dsets 

5471 

5472 def traj_fields_map(self, func, fields, args, 

5473 map_func=map, idxs=False, traj_sel=None): 

5474 """Function for mapping work onto field of trajectories. 

5475 

5476 Parameters 

5477 ---------- 

5478 func : callable 

5479 The function to apply to the trajectory fields (by 

5480 cycle). Must accept a dictionary mapping string trajectory 

5481 field names to a feature vector for that cycle and return 

5482 an arraylike. May accept other positional arguments as well. 

5483 

5484 fields : list of str 

5485 A list of trajectory field names to pass to the mapped function. 

5486 

5487 args : None or or tuple 

5488 A single tuple of arguments which will be 

5489 passed to the mapped function for every evaluation. 

5490 

5491 map_func : callable 

5492 The mapping function. The implementation of how to map the 

5493 computation function over the data. Default is the python 

5494 builtin `map` function. Can be a parallel implementation 

5495 for example. 

5496 

5497 traj_sel : list of tuple, optional 

5498 If not None, a list of trajectory identifier tuple 

5499 (run_idx, traj_idx) to restrict the computation to. 

5500 

5501 idxs : bool 

5502 If True will return the trajectory identifier tuple 

5503 (run_idx, traj_idx) along with other return values. 

5504 

5505 Returns 

5506 ------- 

5507 traj_id_tuples : list of tuple of int, if 'idxs' option is True 

5508 A list of the tuple identifiers for each trajectory result. 

5509 

5510 results : list of arraylike 

5511 A list of arraylike feature vectors for each trajectory. 

5512 

5513 """ 

5514 

5515 # check the args and kwargs to see if they need expanded for 

5516 # mapping inputs 

5517 #first go through each run and get the number of cycles 

5518 n_cycles = 0 

5519 for run_idx in self.run_idxs: 

5520 n_cycles += self.num_run_cycles(run_idx) 

5521 

5522 mapped_args = [] 

5523 for arg in args: 

5524 # make a generator out of it to map as inputs 

5525 mapped_arg = (arg for i in range(n_cycles)) 

5526 mapped_args.append(mapped_arg) 

5527 

5528 # make a generator for the arguments to pass to the function 

5529 # from the mapper, for the extra arguments we just have an 

5530 # endless generator 

5531 map_args = (self.iter_trajs_fields(fields, traj_sel=traj_sel, idxs=False), 

5532 *(it.repeat(arg) for arg in args)) 

5533 

5534 results = map_func(func, *map_args) 

5535 

5536 if idxs: 

5537 if traj_sel is None: 

5538 traj_sel = self.run_traj_idx_tuples() 

5539 return zip(traj_sel, results) 

5540 else: 

5541 return results 

5542 

5543 def to_mdtraj(self, run_idx, traj_idx, frames=None, alt_rep=None): 

5544 """Convert a trajectory to an mdtraj Trajectory object. 

5545 

5546 Works if the right trajectory fields are defined. Minimally 

5547 this is a representation, including the 'positions' field or 

5548 an 'alt_rep' subfield. 

5549 

5550 Will also set the unitcell lengths and angle if the 

5551 'box_vectors' field is present. 

5552 

5553 Will also set the time for the frames if the 'time' field is 

5554 present, although this is likely not useful since walker 

5555 segments have the time reset. 

5556 

5557 Parameters 

5558 ---------- 

5559 run_idx : int 

5560 traj_idx : int 

5561 

5562 frames : None or list of int 

5563 If not None, a list of the frames to include. 

5564 

5565 alt_rep : str 

5566 If not None, an 'alt_reps' subfield name to use for 

5567 positions instead of the 'positions' field. 

5568 

5569 Returns 

5570 ------- 

5571 traj : mdtraj.Trajectory 

5572 

5573 """ 

5574 

5575 traj_grp = self.traj(run_idx, traj_idx) 

5576 

5577 # the default for alt_rep is the main rep 

5578 if alt_rep is None: 

5579 rep_key = POSITIONS 

5580 rep_path = rep_key 

5581 else: 

5582 rep_key = alt_rep 

5583 rep_path = '{}/{}'.format(ALT_REPS, alt_rep) 

5584 

5585 topology = self.get_mdtraj_topology(alt_rep=rep_key) 

5586 

5587 

5588 # get the frames if they are not given 

5589 if frames is None: 

5590 frames = self.get_traj_field_cycle_idxs(run_idx, traj_idx, rep_path) 

5591 

5592 

5593 # get the data for all or for the frames specified 

5594 positions = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, rep_path, 

5595 frames=frames, masked=False) 

5596 try: 

5597 time = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, TIME, 

5598 frames=frames, masked=False)[:, 0] 

5599 except KeyError: 

5600 warn("time not in this trajectory, ignoring") 

5601 time = None 

5602 

5603 try: 

5604 box_vectors = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, BOX_VECTORS, 

5605 frames=frames, masked=False) 

5606 except KeyError: 

5607 warn("box_vectors not in this trajectory, ignoring") 

5608 box_vectors = None 

5609 

5610 

5611 if box_vectors is not None: 

5612 unitcell_lengths, unitcell_angles = traj_box_vectors_to_lengths_angles(box_vectors) 

5613 

5614 if (box_vectors is not None) and (time is not None): 

5615 traj = mdj.Trajectory(positions, topology, 

5616 time=time, 

5617 unitcell_lengths=unitcell_lengths, unitcell_angles=unitcell_angles) 

5618 elif box_vectors is not None: 

5619 traj = mdj.Trajectory(positions, topology, 

5620 unitcell_lengths=unitcell_lengths, unitcell_angles=unitcell_angles) 

5621 elif time is not None: 

5622 traj = mdj.Trajectory(positions, topology, 

5623 time=time) 

5624 else: 

5625 traj = mdj.Trajectory(positions, topology) 

5626 

5627 return traj 

5628 

5629 def trace_to_mdtraj(self, trace, alt_rep=None): 

5630 """Generate an mdtraj Trajectory from a trace of frames from the runs. 

5631 

5632 Uses the default fields for positions (unless an alternate 

5633 representation is specified) and box vectors which are assumed 

5634 to be present in the trajectory fields. 

5635 

5636 The time value for the mdtraj trajectory is set to the cycle 

5637 indices for each trace frame. 

5638 

5639 This is useful for converting WepyHDF5 data to common 

5640 molecular dynamics data formats accessible through the mdtraj 

5641 library. 

5642 

5643 Parameters 

5644 ---------- 

5645 trace : list of tuple of int 

5646 The trace values. Each tuple is of the form 

5647 (run_idx, traj_idx, frame_idx). 

5648 

5649 alt_rep : None or str 

5650 If None uses default 'positions' representation otherwise 

5651 chooses the representation from the 'alt_reps' compound field. 

5652 

5653 Returns 

5654 ------- 

5655 traj : mdtraj.Trajectory 

5656 

5657 """ 

5658 

5659 rep_path = self._choose_rep_path(alt_rep) 

5660 

5661 trace_fields = self.get_trace_fields(trace, [rep_path, BOX_VECTORS]) 

5662 

5663 return self.traj_fields_to_mdtraj(trace_fields, alt_rep=alt_rep) 

5664 

5665 def run_trace_to_mdtraj(self, run_idx, trace, alt_rep=None): 

5666 """Generate an mdtraj Trajectory from a trace of frames from the runs. 

5667 

5668 Uses the default fields for positions (unless an alternate 

5669 representation is specified) and box vectors which are assumed 

5670 to be present in the trajectory fields. 

5671 

5672 The time value for the mdtraj trajectory is set to the cycle 

5673 indices for each trace frame. 

5674 

5675 This is useful for converting WepyHDF5 data to common 

5676 molecular dynamics data formats accessible through the mdtraj 

5677 library. 

5678 

5679 Parameters 

5680 ---------- 

5681 run_idx : int 

5682 The run the trace is over. 

5683 

5684 run_trace : list of tuple of int 

5685 The trace values. Each tuple is of the form 

5686 (traj_idx, frame_idx). 

5687 

5688 alt_rep : None or str 

5689 If None uses default 'positions' representation otherwise 

5690 chooses the representation from the 'alt_reps' compound field. 

5691 

5692 Returns 

5693 ------- 

5694 traj : mdtraj.Trajectory 

5695 

5696 """ 

5697 

5698 rep_path = self._choose_rep_path(alt_rep) 

5699 

5700 trace_fields = self.get_run_trace_fields(run_idx, trace, [rep_path, BOX_VECTORS]) 

5701 

5702 return self.traj_fields_to_mdtraj(trace_fields, alt_rep=alt_rep) 

5703 

5704 def _choose_rep_path(self, alt_rep): 

5705 """Given a positions specification string, gets the field name/path 

5706 for it. 

5707 

5708 Parameters 

5709 ---------- 

5710 

5711 alt_rep : str 

5712 The short name (non relative path) for a representation of 

5713 the positions. 

5714 

5715 Returns 

5716 ------- 

5717 

5718 rep_path : str 

5719 The relative field path to that representation. 

5720 

5721 E.g.: 

5722 

5723 If you give it 'positions' or None it will simply return 

5724 'positions', however if you ask for 'all_atoms' it will return 

5725 'alt_reps/all_atoms'. 

5726 

5727 """ 

5728 

5729 # the default for alt_rep is the main rep 

5730 if alt_rep == POSITIONS: 

5731 rep_path = POSITIONS 

5732 elif alt_rep is None: 

5733 rep_key = POSITIONS 

5734 rep_path = rep_key 

5735 # if it is already a path we don't add more to it and just 

5736 # return it. 

5737 elif len(alt_rep.split('/')) > 1: 

5738 if len(alt_rep.split('/')) > 2: 

5739 raise ValueError("unrecognized alt_rep spec") 

5740 elif alt_rep.split('/')[0] != ALT_REPS: 

5741 raise ValueError("unrecognized alt_rep spec") 

5742 else: 

5743 rep_path = alt_rep 

5744 else: 

5745 rep_key = alt_rep 

5746 rep_path = '{}/{}'.format(ALT_REPS, alt_rep) 

5747 

5748 return rep_path 

5749 

5750 

5751 def traj_fields_to_mdtraj(self, traj_fields, alt_rep=POSITIONS): 

5752 """Create an mdtraj.Trajectory from a traj_fields dictionary. 

5753 

5754 Parameters 

5755 ---------- 

5756 

5757 traj_fields : dict of str : arraylike 

5758 Dictionary of the traj fields to their values 

5759 

5760 alt_reps : str 

5761 The base alt rep name for the positions representation to 

5762 use for the topology, should have the corresponding 

5763 alt_rep field in the traj_fields 

5764 

5765 Returns 

5766 ------- 

5767 

5768 traj : mdtraj.Trajectory object 

5769 

5770 This is mainly a convenience function to retrieve the correct 

5771 topology for the positions which will be passed to the generic 

5772 `traj_fields_to_mdtraj` function. 

5773 

5774 """ 

5775 

5776 rep_path = self._choose_rep_path(alt_rep) 

5777 

5778 json_topology = self.get_topology(alt_rep=rep_path) 

5779 

5780 return traj_fields_to_mdtraj(traj_fields, json_topology, rep_key=rep_path) 

5781 

5782 

5783 

5784 def copy_run_slice(self, run_idx, target_file_path, target_grp_path, 

5785 run_slice=None, mode='x'): 

5786 """Copy this run to another HDF5 file (target_file_path) at the group 

5787 (target_grp_path)""" 

5788 

5789 assert mode in ['w', 'w-', 'x', 'r+'], "must be opened in write mode" 

5790 

5791 if run_slice is not None: 

5792 assert run_slice[1] >= run_slice[0], "Must be a contiguous slice" 

5793 

5794 # get a list of the frames to use 

5795 slice_frames = list(range(*run_slice)) 

5796 

5797 

5798 # we manually construct an HDF5 wrapper and copy the groups over 

5799 new_h5 = h5py.File(target_file_path, mode=mode, libver=H5PY_LIBVER) 

5800 

5801 # flush the datasets buffers 

5802 self.h5.flush() 

5803 new_h5.flush() 

5804 

5805 # get the run group we are interested in 

5806 run_grp = self.run(run_idx) 

5807 

5808 # slice the datasets in the run and set them in the new file 

5809 if run_slice is not None: 

5810 

5811 # initialize the group for the run 

5812 new_run_grp = new_h5.require_group(target_grp_path) 

5813 

5814 

5815 # copy the init walkers group 

5816 self.h5.copy(run_grp[INIT_WALKERS], new_run_grp, 

5817 name=INIT_WALKERS) 

5818 

5819 # copy the decision group 

5820 self.h5.copy(run_grp[DECISION], new_run_grp, 

5821 name=DECISION) 

5822 

5823 

5824 # create the trajectories group 

5825 new_trajs_grp = new_run_grp.require_group(TRAJECTORIES) 

5826 

5827 # slice the trajectories and copy them 

5828 for traj_idx in run_grp[TRAJECTORIES]: 

5829 

5830 traj_grp = run_grp[TRAJECTORIES][traj_idx] 

5831 

5832 traj_id = "{}/{}".format(TRAJECTORIES, traj_idx) 

5833 

5834 new_traj_grp = new_trajs_grp.require_group(str(traj_idx)) 

5835 

5836 for field_name in _iter_field_paths(run_grp[traj_id]): 

5837 field_path = "{}/{}".format(traj_id, field_name) 

5838 

5839 data = self.get_traj_field(run_idx, traj_idx, field_name, 

5840 frames=slice_frames) 

5841 

5842 # if it is a sparse field we need to create the 

5843 # dataset differently 

5844 if field_name in self.sparse_fields: 

5845 

5846 # create a group for the field 

5847 new_field_grp = new_traj_grp.require_group(field_name) 

5848 

5849 # slice the _sparse_idxs from the original 

5850 # dataset that are between the slice 

5851 cycle_idxs = self.traj(run_idx, traj_idx)[field_name]['_sparse_idxs'][:] 

5852 

5853 sparse_idx_idxs = np.argwhere(np.logical_and( 

5854 cycle_idxs[:] >= run_slice[0], cycle_idxs[:] < run_slice[1] 

5855 )).flatten().tolist() 

5856 

5857 # the cycle idxs there is data for 

5858 sliced_cycle_idxs = cycle_idxs[sparse_idx_idxs] 

5859 

5860 # get the data for these cycles 

5861 field_data = data[sliced_cycle_idxs] 

5862 

5863 # get the information on compression, 

5864 # chunking, and filters and use it when we set 

5865 # the new data 

5866 field_data_dset = traj_grp[field_name]['data'] 

5867 data_dset_kwargs = { 

5868 'chunks' : field_data_dset.chunks, 

5869 'compression' : field_data_dset.compression, 

5870 'compression_opts' : field_data_dset.compression_opts, 

5871 'shuffle' : field_data_dset.shuffle, 

5872 'fletcher32' : field_data_dset.fletcher32, 

5873 } 

5874 

5875 # and for the sparse idxs although it is probably overkill 

5876 field_idxs_dset = traj_grp[field_name]['_sparse_idxs'] 

5877 idxs_dset_kwargs = { 

5878 'chunks' : field_idxs_dset.chunks, 

5879 'compression' : field_idxs_dset.compression, 

5880 'compression_opts' : field_idxs_dset.compression_opts, 

5881 'shuffle' : field_idxs_dset.shuffle, 

5882 'fletcher32' : field_idxs_dset.fletcher32, 

5883 } 

5884 

5885 # then create the datasets 

5886 new_field_grp.create_dataset('_sparse_idxs', 

5887 data=sliced_cycle_idxs, 

5888 **idxs_dset_kwargs) 

5889 new_field_grp.create_dataset('data', 

5890 data=field_data, 

5891 **data_dset_kwargs) 

5892 

5893 else: 

5894 

5895 # get the information on compression, 

5896 # chunking, and filters and use it when we set 

5897 # the new data 

5898 field_dset = traj_grp[field_name] 

5899 

5900 dset_kwargs = { 

5901 'chunks' : field_dset.chunks, 

5902 'compression' : field_dset.compression, 

5903 'compression_opts' : field_dset.compression_opts, 

5904 'shuffle' : field_dset.shuffle, 

5905 'fletcher32' : field_dset.fletcher32, 

5906 } 

5907 

5908 # require the dataset first to automatically build 

5909 # subpaths for compound fields if necessary 

5910 dset = new_traj_grp.require_dataset(field_name, 

5911 data.shape, data.dtype, 

5912 **dset_kwargs) 

5913 

5914 # then set the data depending on whether it is 

5915 # sparse or not 

5916 dset[:] = data 

5917 

5918 # then do it for the records 

5919 for rec_grp_name, rec_fields in self.record_fields.items(): 

5920 

5921 rec_grp = run_grp[rec_grp_name] 

5922 

5923 # if this is a contiguous record we can skip the cycle 

5924 # indices to record indices conversion that is 

5925 # necessary for sporadic records 

5926 if self._is_sporadic_records(rec_grp_name): 

5927 

5928 cycle_idxs = rec_grp[CYCLE_IDXS][:] 

5929 

5930 # get dataset info 

5931 cycle_idxs_dset = rec_grp[CYCLE_IDXS] 

5932 

5933 # we use autochunk, because I can't figure out how 

5934 # the chunks are set and I can't reuse them 

5935 idxs_dset_kwargs = { 

5936 'chunks' : True, 

5937 # 'chunks' : cycle_idxs_dset.chunks, 

5938 'compression' : cycle_idxs_dset.compression, 

5939 'compression_opts' : cycle_idxs_dset.compression_opts, 

5940 'shuffle' : cycle_idxs_dset.shuffle, 

5941 'fletcher32' : cycle_idxs_dset.fletcher32, 

5942 } 

5943 

5944 # get the indices of the records we are interested in 

5945 record_idxs = np.argwhere(np.logical_and( 

5946 cycle_idxs >= run_slice[0], cycle_idxs < run_slice[1] 

5947 )).flatten().tolist() 

5948 

5949 # set the cycle indices in the new run group 

5950 new_recgrp_cycle_idxs_path = '{}/{}/_cycle_idxs'.format(target_grp_path, 

5951 rec_grp_name) 

5952 cycle_data = cycle_idxs[record_idxs] 

5953 

5954 cycle_dset = new_h5.require_dataset(new_recgrp_cycle_idxs_path, 

5955 cycle_data.shape, cycle_data.dtype, 

5956 **idxs_dset_kwargs) 

5957 cycle_dset[:] = cycle_data 

5958 

5959 # if contiguous just set the record indices as the 

5960 # range between the slice 

5961 else: 

5962 record_idxs = list(range(run_slice[0], run_slice[1])) 

5963 

5964 # then for each rec_field slice those and set them in the new file 

5965 for rec_field in rec_fields: 

5966 

5967 field_dset = rec_grp[rec_field] 

5968 

5969 # get dataset info 

5970 field_dset_kwargs = { 

5971 'chunks' : True, 

5972 # 'chunks' : field_dset.chunks, 

5973 'compression' : field_dset.compression, 

5974 'compression_opts' : field_dset.compression_opts, 

5975 'shuffle' : field_dset.shuffle, 

5976 'fletcher32' : field_dset.fletcher32, 

5977 } 

5978 

5979 

5980 rec_field_path = "{}/{}".format(rec_grp_name, rec_field) 

5981 new_recfield_grp_path = '{}/{}'.format(target_grp_path, rec_field_path) 

5982 

5983 # if it is a variable length dtype make the dtype 

5984 # that for the dataset and we also slice the 

5985 # dataset differently 

5986 vlen_type = h5py.check_dtype(vlen=field_dset.dtype) 

5987 if vlen_type is not None: 

5988 

5989 dtype = h5py.special_dtype(vlen=vlen_type) 

5990 

5991 else: 

5992 dtype = field_dset.dtype 

5993 

5994 

5995 

5996 # if there are no records don't attempt to add them 

5997 # get the shape 

5998 shape = (len(record_idxs), *field_dset.shape[1:]) 

5999 

6000 new_field_dset = new_h5.require_dataset(new_recfield_grp_path, 

6001 shape, dtype, 

6002 **field_dset_kwargs) 

6003 

6004 # if there aren't records just don't do anything, 

6005 # and if there are get them and add them 

6006 if len(record_idxs) > 0: 

6007 rec_data = field_dset[record_idxs] 

6008 

6009 # if it is a variable length data type we have 

6010 # to do it 1 by 1 

6011 if vlen_type is not None: 

6012 for i, vlen_rec in enumerate(rec_data): 

6013 new_field_dset[i] = rec_data[i] 

6014 # otherwise just set it all at once 

6015 else: 

6016 new_field_dset[:] = rec_data 

6017 

6018 # just copy the whole thing over, since this will probably be 

6019 # more efficient 

6020 else: 

6021 

6022 # split off the last bit of the target path, for copying we 

6023 # need it's parent group but not it to exist 

6024 target_grp_path_basename = target_grp_path.split('/')[-1] 

6025 target_grp_path_prefix = target_grp_path.split('/')[:-1] 

6026 

6027 new_run_prefix_grp = self.h5.require_group(target_grp_path_prefix) 

6028 

6029 # copy the whole thing 

6030 self.h5.copy(run_grp, new_run_prefix_grp, 

6031 name=target_grp_path_basename) 

6032 

6033 # flush the datasets buffers 

6034 self.h5.flush() 

6035 new_h5.flush() 

6036 

6037 return new_h5
